file_content.text: With Lakkna gone, her men should scatter. I'll make sure they stay scattered.
My proximity alarms aren't showing more than a droid or two. Looks like you whittled them down nicely.
Though, I guess that means Lakkna's gone, too. She wouldn't have let them be destroyed, not without a fight.
Lakkna went easily. I made sure of it.
She didn't suffer.
Thanks. If we can't give our enemies some dignity, we're on the wrong side, right?
Yes. This is over.
She was a danger that needed to be removed, that's all.
Don't be sentimental.
Maybe so. But she wasn't like other Gormak. Makes you wonder.
Here. I appreciate what you did, but keeping Sith droids out of Gormak hands--that deserves more than just a thank-you.
If we don't get those droids back, next time Lakkna shows up, it'll be with a small army.
Good, at least someone's making it through. She's not found a way past yet....
Good, people are making it through. She's not found a way past yet....
Sorry. You must be here for the ship. The one the Gormak were looking for. Turns out they found more than just a wreck.
The marshes around that ship were full of deactivated war droids, probably its cargo or crew. Now they belong to the Gormak. That's really bad news.
You didn't say how many were injured in this raid.
Was anyone hurt?
No one. I'm guessing her priority was the droids, not a body count. And by "she," I mean Lakkna.
I understand the risks, but if the Gormak want to learn from us, that could open some channels.
Their curiosity may be useful.
Maybe in twenty years or so, but right now she just wants a droid army. And by "she," I mean Lakkna.
The more chances they have to study our technology, the worse their weapons are going to get.
Right. Gormak adapt tech.
And that's just the beginning. I know who's behind this; Lakkna's planning something big.
A whole raid for some scrap metal? The Gormak need to rethink their priorities.
Not much of a heist.
I know who was leading that raid, and to her, those droids are priceless. Her name's Lakkna.
I know the Gormak use those cyber-beasts, but I haven't run into any of their droids.
I've never seen Gormak droids.
To the Gormak, droids are taboo, abominations. They think she's crazy to go after them. And by "she," I mean Lakkna.
Why?
Because salvaging those droids will teach the Gormak how to make their own. And I saw who was leading that raid: Lakkna.
Lakkna's a Gormak... warlord, I guess. Tough, ambitious, incredibly smart--she led the Gormak excavation team right here.
I hate to do it, but we've got to cut through those droids and take her down. I need the best to take care of it. She shouldn't suffer.
Have you tried diplomacy?
My negotiator was chased off with blaster fire. She's not interested in talking.
Leave Lakkna to me. If I can make this painless, I will.
She won't, I'll see to it.
It almost sounds like you don't want Lakkna dead.
You admire her.
Maybe. I respect her. But if it's a choice between Lakkna and the Voss, there's no question.
All our droids have homing devices, so they don't trample anything the Voss care about. Gives us a lead on Lakkna's base.
Most important thing is getting those droids out of Gormak hands. But be sure you take down Lakkna, too. We'll never get a better chance.
You handle her. [Refuse quest]
Fine. I'll watch out for Lakkna marching at the head of a droid army.
She's too smart for her own good.
Things just got worse.
I'm sorry to lay this on you. But she was deadly enough without a pack of war droids at her command. And by "she," I mean Lakkna.
